richardhjensen wrote:

>I don't know if other people have this problem or not,
>but I've used Mike Clark's JWhich to debug some classpath
>problems with my Ant scripts. I typically build explicit
>classpaths in my ant scripts (usually out of properties
>defined in runlib.properties).
>

Neat!  Funny I never thought to try that myself being fond of JWhich.

I've written JUnit tests that use JWhich to assert things I expect are 
in the classpath, but Ant classpaths can be tricky.  Folks on the Ant 
mailing list might find this useful, as well.

Thanks!

Mike
